author: Michael ProHypeBeast
text:
For this transaction, bad. I made the offer, the buyer accepted it, and then when I went to pay it wouldn’t let me. I had the money in my PayPal account and the Grailed server kept giving me error messages. The next day someone else had purchased the item that I wanted. It’s funny that I got a review request for a failed transaction. These failed transactions happen a lot on Grailed. I wonder how many times a buyer has tried to pay for my item and this has happened 

Also, if a buyer makes an offer and the seller accepts and then the buyer never pays, nothing happens. This wastes a lot of time and makes the selling community not like Grailed. We talk about it. Thanks

author: nairb49
text:
Terrific platform, but constant bugs in the app. Unfortunately due to nature of resellers, and consumer base who look to resell goods such as Supreme, limited Nikes etc, can be very annoying to deal with "wuts ur lowest brah?", but not necessarily Grailed's fault, though they could encourage better communication between members. 

Most aggravating is their policy to be able to accept as many offers as you like as a seller, and make as many offers as you like as a buyer, but then to have no obligation to follow through on any accepted offers. Ends up being a significant waste of time, why is this a policy? Really not sure what the impetus behind this policy is, or what they are aiming to achieve? Sellers trying to wheedle more out of buyers by artificially creating bidding wars?

Accepted offers should be binding, unless there is a good reason to back out. 

Quick search for items shows tons of users with statements like "Do not make offers unless you are prepared to pay within 24h of your offer being accepted" etc etc
title: Terrific platform-But needs changes
